allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add PM-centric wireframing tools to toolbar

Expanded the drawing toolbar with 7 new PM-focused tools that leverage existing primitives and sketch-style rendering:

Layout & Structure:
- Section/Container: Labeled bounding box \(rectangle + label text\) with ''section'' semantic tag
- Divider: Horizontal line \(1px height rectangle\) for visual separation

UI Intent:
- Button: Grouped rectangle + centered text with ''button'' semantic tag
- Input Field: Grouped rectangle + placeholder text with ''input'' semantic tag  
- Checkbox: Grouped small square + label text with ''input'' semantic tag

Annotation:
- Callout/Note: Grouped text box + arrow pointer for annotations
- State Badge: Grouped small rectangle + state text \(Empty/Loading/Error/Success\)

Design Decisions:
- All tools use click-to-place \(no drag interaction\)
- Compound tools \(button, input, checkbox, section, callout, badge\) create grouped elements
- Groups are editable, movable, and ungroupable \(G key\)
- All elements inherit existing sketch-style rendering
- Reused existing ComponentGroup system for grouping
- Semantic tags applied where applicable for export
- No styling controls, variants, or layout changes introduced

Tools Intentionally Excluded:
- Dropdown menus \(interaction complexity\)
- Radio buttons \(similar to checkbox, redundant\)
- Toggle switches \(visual variant of checkbox\)
- Icon placeholders \(no unique value over rectangle\)
- Multi-line text areas \(same as text primitive\)
- Tabs \(layout complexity\)

Technical Implementation:
- Extended Tool type with 7 new values
- Updated Toolbar with visual category separators
- Added tool creation logic in Canvas handleMouseDown
- All tools compose existing RectangleElement, TextElement, ArrowElement primitives
- Grouped tools use existing ComponentGroup system

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
